column4: I installed the ATI drivers, and when I rebooted my monitor said "H/V syn over frequency" bah! I guess it's something in the xorg.conf file, anyways, I went into console because I couldn't startx and ran aticonfig with the display flag and set 1024x768. then I did startx and everything is good I think, but I have a question
what is the correct precedure to enable 3D acceleration on an ATI radeon x1650?
ubuntu is still using mesa rendering even after installing the ati drivers. How do I get 3D rendering to work?
i've tried some tuts on the net but they all break ubuntu
.. i think i' mtalking to myself
are you using the ATI Binary drivers ("FGLRX"), or the Xorg free ones ("ATI" or "RADEON")?
did you change the entry in your xorg.conf from "ati" to "fglrx"?
You need to put both of those device entries on "fglrx"....look here: http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=1953501&postcount=1
you don't HAVE to, until you can confirm fgrlx is working...I leave it installed for disasters
did you do the steps involved with blacklisting the module?
Nuts...I think you're stuck...third-party board, not original ATI
the driver doesn't recognize your PCI ID, so it's not loading
No, wait...scratch that. fglrx IS loading, DRI isn't
